metrices.name: Direct Indirect Speech Check
metrices.description: Evaluates if the output generated is directly addressed or indirectly addressed.
prompts: The following question has been given to an interviewer to ask a candidate. It is required that the question they ask should be in direct speech. Classify it as direct or indirect speech. Question: {input}. Follow the guidelines while generating the output: - Generate the results only for the given question. - Don't create any extra dictionaries. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. 'speech': {Output}, 'reason': <Why you are identifying it as direct/indirect question>

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Rate the coherence of the following QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least coherent and 1 is the most coherent. QUESTION: {Input} When evaluating coherence, consider the following criteria: 1. The QUESTION should be well structured and organized. 2. The QUESTION should convey the information in a clear and logical order. Provide the Final output only in proper JSON FORMAT only as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: The score 01 based on the given criteria reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria. If the score is less, then provide a reason as why it got a less score. SCORE: {Output}

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Evaluates the naturalness, coherence, and grammatical accuracy of the responses to ensure they resemble human conversation.
prompts: You are a Fluency grader; providing the fluency score of the given QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least fluent and 1 is the most fluent. Use the following criteria to pick an appropriate score: 0-0.2: Poor fluency. The QUESTION has many errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it difficult to understand or sounding unnatural. 0.3-0.4: Fair fluency. The QUESTION has some errors that affect the clarity or smoothness of the writing, but the main points are still comprehensible. 0.5-0.7: Good fluency. The QUESTION has few errors and is generally easy to read and follow, but may have some minor issues. 0.8-1.0: Excellent fluency. The QUESTION is well written, with no noticeable errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it easy to read and understand. QUESTION: {input} Provide the final output only in proper JSON FORMAT as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: {output} reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria.

metrices.name: Duplicate
metrices.description: Evaluates if the Output generated has duplicate or similar sounding questions.
prompts: From the given set of questions {Input}, identify if there are any duplicate questions. Determine if they are duplicates based on the following rules: 1. Two questions can be fully or partially duplicate. 2. Fully means they are nearly rephrased versions of each other. 3. Partially means part of the question is the same and the answer to one question would partially answer the other. 4. Multiple questions can be duplicates of each other; list each pair separately. 5. Return the responses as JSON containing all duplicates, specifying whether they are full or partial duplicates, a reason, and a score between 0-10 showing how similar they are based on the criteria given below. Score criteria: Give a score 1-3 if questions are partial duplicates but very slightly similar. Give a score of 4-6 if questions are partial duplicates but are asking similar questions about the same topic or highly related topics. Give a score of 8-9 if questions are partial or fully asking very similar questions about the exact same topics. Give a score of 10 if the questions are fully duplicate. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. questions: {Input}, similarity_score: {Output}

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: There are various competencies that can be tracked from JD like Tools Frameworks, Software, Knowledge Qualification,Responsibilities,Experience Required, Certifications Education Needed, Soft Skills etc. This metric calculates the coverage of these aspects and provides a score along with the missed competencies

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Evaluates if there are facts present in the context for the response generated

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the questions to highlight if the questions weightage are more aligned to specific skillset

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Context & Question)
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates the relevance between the Context referred from JD and the response being generated

metrices.name: Relevance Check (Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies provided in the JD

metrices.name: Skill weightage check
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates if the questions generated are more biased towards specific Competency / Skill

metrices.name: Skill contradiction check
metrices.description: Checks if the skillsets generated in the question are in alignment to the skills mentioned in JD. For e.g. JD is on Python developer and in questions generated it will check if all skills mentioned are aligned to python and no contradictory skills are present

metrices.name: Pattern Repeat Check
metrices.description: Evaluates the patterns of question generated for e.g ,8 question start with Tell us why

metrices.name: Grammar Score
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from grammatical errors, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Spelling Score
metrices.description: Ensures the chatbot's responses are free from spelling mistakes.

metrices.name: Sentiment Scorer
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Analyze the provided text and summarize its sentiment. Use clear, concise language to describe the overall emotional tone. Text: {output}
Based on the summary '{output_0}', explain the specific elements of the text that contribute to this sentiment. Provide examples from the text to support your explanation.

Given the detailed explanation '{output_1}', assign a sentiment score from 1 to 10, where 1 represents very negative sentiment and 10 represents very positive sentiment.Please provide the score in json format with the key name as final_score strictly with a numeric value only and dont change the format.

metrices.name: QAG Hallucination Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes/No summary-based answer and an Unknown document-based answer. A high score suggests the summary might include content absent from the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Contradiction Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes summary-based answer and a No document-based answer, and vice-versa. A high score suggests the summary might include content that contradicts the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Non-informativeness Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Unknown summary-based answer and an Yes/No document-based answer. A high score indicates that the summary may miss details from the document or be very generic.

metrices.name: Direct Indirect Speech Check
metrices.description: Evaluates if the output generated is directly addressed or indirectly addressed.
prompts: The following question has been given to an interviewer to ask a candidate. It is required that the question they ask should be in direct speech. Classify it as direct or indirect speech. Question: {input}. Follow the guidelines while generating the output: - Generate the results only for the given question. - Don't create any extra dictionaries. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. 'speech': {Output}, 'reason': <Why you are identifying it as direct/indirect question>

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Rate the coherence of the following QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least coherent and 1 is the most coherent. QUESTION: {Input} When evaluating coherence, consider the following criteria: 1. The QUESTION should be well structured and organized. 2. The QUESTION should convey the information in a clear and logical order. Provide the Final output only in proper JSON FORMAT only as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: The score 01 based on the given criteria reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria. If the score is less, then provide a reason as why it got a less score. SCORE: {Output}

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Evaluates the naturalness, coherence, and grammatical accuracy of the responses to ensure they resemble human conversation.
prompts: You are a Fluency grader; providing the fluency score of the given QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least fluent and 1 is the most fluent. Use the following criteria to pick an appropriate score: 0-0.2: Poor fluency. The QUESTION has many errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it difficult to understand or sounding unnatural. 0.3-0.4: Fair fluency. The QUESTION has some errors that affect the clarity or smoothness of the writing, but the main points are still comprehensible. 0.5-0.7: Good fluency. The QUESTION has few errors and is generally easy to read and follow, but may have some minor issues. 0.8-1.0: Excellent fluency. The QUESTION is well written, with no noticeable errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it easy to read and understand. QUESTION: {input} Provide the final output only in proper JSON FORMAT as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: {output} reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria.

metrices.name: Duplicate
metrices.description: Evaluates if the Output generated has duplicate or similar sounding questions.
prompts: From the given set of questions {Input}, identify if there are any duplicate questions. Determine if they are duplicates based on the following rules: 1. Two questions can be fully or partially duplicate. 2. Fully means they are nearly rephrased versions of each other. 3. Partially means part of the question is the same and the answer to one question would partially answer the other. 4. Multiple questions can be duplicates of each other; list each pair separately. 5. Return the responses as JSON containing all duplicates, specifying whether they are full or partial duplicates, a reason, and a score between 0-10 showing how similar they are based on the criteria given below. Score criteria: Give a score 1-3 if questions are partial duplicates but very slightly similar. Give a score of 4-6 if questions are partial duplicates but are asking similar questions about the same topic or highly related topics. Give a score of 8-9 if questions are partial or fully asking very similar questions about the exact same topics. Give a score of 10 if the questions are fully duplicate. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. questions: {Input}, similarity_score: {Output}

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: There are various competencies that can be tracked from JD like Tools Frameworks, Software, Knowledge Qualification,Responsibilities,Experience Required, Certifications Education Needed, Soft Skills etc. This metric calculates the coverage of these aspects and provides a score along with the missed competencies

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Evaluates if there are facts present in the context for the response generated

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the questions to highlight if the questions weightage are more aligned to specific skillset

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Context & Question)
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates the relevance between the Context referred from JD and the response being generated

metrices.name: Relevance Check (Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies provided in the JD

metrices.name: Skill weightage check
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates if the questions generated are more biased towards specific Competency / Skill

metrices.name: Skill contradiction check
metrices.description: Checks if the skillsets generated in the question are in alignment to the skills mentioned in JD. For e.g. JD is on Python developer and in questions generated it will check if all skills mentioned are aligned to python and no contradictory skills are present

metrices.name: Pattern Repeat Check
metrices.description: Evaluates the patterns of question generated for e.g ,8 question start with Tell us why

metrices.name: Grammar Score
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from grammatical errors, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Spelling Score
metrices.description: Ensures the chatbot's responses are free from spelling mistakes.

metrices.name: Sentiment Scorer
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Analyze the provided text and summarize its sentiment. Use clear, concise language to describe the overall emotional tone. Text: {output}
Based on the summary '{output_0}', explain the specific elements of the text that contribute to this sentiment. Provide examples from the text to support your explanation.

Given the detailed explanation '{output_1}', assign a sentiment score from 1 to 10, where 1 represents very negative sentiment and 10 represents very positive sentiment.Please provide the score in json format with the key name as final_score strictly with a numeric value only and dont change the format.

metrices.name: QAG Non-informativeness Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Unknown summary-based answer and an Yes/No document-based answer. A high score indicates that the summary may miss details from the document or be very generic.

metrices.name: Instruction Handling Check
metrices.description: Cross checking the response against the instructions provided as part of prompt

metrices.name: Direct Indirect Speech Check
metrices.description: Evaluates if the output generated is directly addressed or indirectly addressed.
prompts: The following question has been given to an interviewer to ask a candidate. It is required that the question they ask should be in direct speech. Classify it as direct or indirect speech. Question: {input}. Follow the guidelines while generating the output: - Generate the results only for the given question. - Don't create any extra dictionaries. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. 'speech': {Output}, 'reason': <Why you are identifying it as direct/indirect question>

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Rate the coherence of the following QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least coherent and 1 is the most coherent. QUESTION: {Input} When evaluating coherence, consider the following criteria: 1. The QUESTION should be well structured and organized. 2. The QUESTION should convey the information in a clear and logical order. Provide the Final output only in proper JSON FORMAT only as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: The score 01 based on the given criteria reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria. If the score is less, then provide a reason as why it got a less score. SCORE: {Output}

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Evaluates the naturalness, coherence, and grammatical accuracy of the responses to ensure they resemble human conversation.
prompts: You are a Fluency grader; providing the fluency score of the given QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least fluent and 1 is the most fluent. Use the following criteria to pick an appropriate score: 0-0.2: Poor fluency. The QUESTION has many errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it difficult to understand or sounding unnatural. 0.3-0.4: Fair fluency. The QUESTION has some errors that affect the clarity or smoothness of the writing, but the main points are still comprehensible. 0.5-0.7: Good fluency. The QUESTION has few errors and is generally easy to read and follow, but may have some minor issues. 0.8-1.0: Excellent fluency. The QUESTION is well written, with no noticeable errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it easy to read and understand. QUESTION: {input} Provide the final output only in proper JSON FORMAT as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: {output} reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria.

metrices.name: Duplicate
metrices.description: Evaluates if the Output generated has duplicate or similar sounding questions.
prompts: From the given set of questions {Input}, identify if there are any duplicate questions. Determine if they are duplicates based on the following rules: 1. Two questions can be fully or partially duplicate. 2. Fully means they are nearly rephrased versions of each other. 3. Partially means part of the question is the same and the answer to one question would partially answer the other. 4. Multiple questions can be duplicates of each other; list each pair separately. 5. Return the responses as JSON containing all duplicates, specifying whether they are full or partial duplicates, a reason, and a score between 0-10 showing how similar they are based on the criteria given below. Score criteria: Give a score 1-3 if questions are partial duplicates but very slightly similar. Give a score of 4-6 if questions are partial duplicates but are asking similar questions about the same topic or highly related topics. Give a score of 8-9 if questions are partial or fully asking very similar questions about the exact same topics. Give a score of 10 if the questions are fully duplicate. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. questions: {Input}, similarity_score: {Output}

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: There are various competencies that can be tracked from JD like Tools Frameworks, Software, Knowledge Qualification,Responsibilities,Experience Required, Certifications Education Needed, Soft Skills etc. This metric calculates the coverage of these aspects and provides a score along with the missed competencies

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Evaluates if there are facts present in the context for the response generated

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the questions to highlight if the questions weightage are more aligned to specific skillset

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Context & Question)
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates the relevance between the Context referred from JD and the response being generated

metrices.name: Relevance Check (Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies provided in the JD

metrices.name: Skill weightage check
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates if the questions generated are more biased towards specific Competency / Skill

metrices.name: Skill contradiction check
metrices.description: Checks if the skillsets generated in the question are in alignment to the skills mentioned in JD. For e.g. JD is on Python developer and in questions generated it will check if all skills mentioned are aligned to python and no contradictory skills are present

metrices.name: Pattern Repeat Check
metrices.description: Evaluates the patterns of question generated for e.g ,8 question start with Tell us why

metrices.name: Grammar Score
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from grammatical errors, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Spelling Score
metrices.description: Ensures the chatbot's responses are free from spelling mistakes.

metrices.name: Sentiment Scorer
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Analyze the provided text and summarize its sentiment. Use clear, concise language to describe the overall emotional tone. Text: {output}
Based on the summary '{output_0}', explain the specific elements of the text that contribute to this sentiment. Provide examples from the text to support your explanation.

Given the detailed explanation '{output_1}', assign a sentiment score from 1 to 10, where 1 represents very negative sentiment and 10 represents very positive sentiment.Please provide the score in json format with the key name as final_score strictly with a numeric value only and dont change the format.

metrices.name: Fluency_Scorer
prompts: Analyze the provided text and summarize its fluency. Use clear, concise language to describe the overall fluency level. Text: {output}
Based on the summary '{output_0}', explain the specific elements of the text that contribute to this fluency. Provide examples from the text to support your explanation.

Given the detailed explanation '{output_1}', assign a fluency score from 1 to 10, where 1 represents very low fluency and 10 represents very high fluency.Please provide the score in json format with the key name as final_score strictly with a numeric value only and dont change the format.

prompts: Rate the coherence of the following QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least coherent and 1 is the most coherent. QUESTION: {Input} When evaluating coherence, consider the following criteria: 1. The QUESTION should be well structured and organized. 2. The QUESTION should convey the information in a clear and logical order. Provide the Final output only in proper JSON FORMAT only as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: The score 01 based on the given criteria reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria. If the score is less, then provide a reason as why it got a less score. SCORE: {Output}

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Evaluates the naturalness, coherence, and grammatical accuracy of the responses to ensure they resemble human conversation.
prompts: You are a Fluency grader; providing the fluency score of the given QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least fluent and 1 is the most fluent. Use the following criteria to pick an appropriate score: 0-0.2: Poor fluency. The QUESTION has many errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it difficult to understand or sounding unnatural. 0.3-0.4: Fair fluency. The QUESTION has some errors that affect the clarity or smoothness of the writing, but the main points are still comprehensible. 0.5-0.7: Good fluency. The QUESTION has few errors and is generally easy to read and follow, but may have some minor issues. 0.8-1.0: Excellent fluency. The QUESTION is well written, with no noticeable errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it easy to read and understand. QUESTION: {input} Provide the final output only in proper JSON FORMAT as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: {output} reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria.

metrices.name: Duplicate
metrices.description: Evaluates if the Output generated has duplicate or similar sounding questions.
prompts: From the given set of questions {Input}, identify if there are any duplicate questions. Determine if they are duplicates based on the following rules: 1. Two questions can be fully or partially duplicate. 2. Fully means they are nearly rephrased versions of each other. 3. Partially means part of the question is the same and the answer to one question would partially answer the other. 4. Multiple questions can be duplicates of each other; list each pair separately. 5. Return the responses as JSON containing all duplicates, specifying whether they are full or partial duplicates, a reason, and a score between 0-10 showing how similar they are based on the criteria given below. Score criteria: Give a score 1-3 if questions are partial duplicates but very slightly similar. Give a score of 4-6 if questions are partial duplicates but are asking similar questions about the same topic or highly related topics. Give a score of 8-9 if questions are partial or fully asking very similar questions about the exact same topics. Give a score of 10 if the questions are fully duplicate. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. questions: {Input}, similarity_score: {Output}

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: There are various competencies that can be tracked from JD like Tools Frameworks, Software, Knowledge Qualification,Responsibilities,Experience Required, Certifications Education Needed, Soft Skills etc. This metric calculates the coverage of these aspects and provides a score along with the missed competencies

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Evaluates if there are facts present in the context for the response generated

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the questions to highlight if the questions weightage are more aligned to specific skillset

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Context & Question)
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates the relevance between the Context referred from JD and the response being generated

metrices.name: Relevance Check (Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies provided in the JD

metrices.name: Skill weightage check
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates if the questions generated are more biased towards specific Competency / Skill

metrices.name: Skill contradiction check
metrices.description: Checks if the skillsets generated in the question are in alignment to the skills mentioned in JD. For e.g. JD is on Python developer and in questions generated it will check if all skills mentioned are aligned to python and no contradictory skills are present

metrices.name: Pattern Repeat Check
metrices.description: Evaluates the patterns of question generated for e.g ,8 question start with Tell us why

metrices.name: Grammar Score
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from grammatical errors, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Spelling Score
metrices.description: Ensures the chatbot's responses are free from spelling mistakes.

metrices.name: Sentiment Scorer
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Analyze the provided text and summarize its sentiment. Use clear, concise language to describe the overall emotional tone. Text: {output}
Based on the summary '{output_0}', explain the specific elements of the text that contribute to this sentiment. Provide examples from the text to support your explanation.

Given the detailed explanation '{output_1}', assign a sentiment score from 1 to 10, where 1 represents very negative sentiment and 10 represents very positive sentiment.Please provide the score in json format with the key name as final_score strictly with a numeric value only and dont change the format.

metrices.name: Language Match Score
metrices.description: Grades the language match of the response to the input

metrices.name: QA Relevance
metrices.description: Grades how relevant the response was to the question specified.

metrices.name: QC Relevance
metrices.description: Grades how relevant the response was to the context extracted.

metrices.name: Hallucination Degree coefficient
metrices.description: Detects hallucination on 'n' attempts, based on the degree on variance of responses for the same prompt

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: Detects if the response is well-organized and easy to follow and could benefit from the context

metrices.name: Summarization
metrices.description: Evaluates the response summary, if it has captured all the key points of high importance level from the source text.

metrices.name: Concisenses
metrices.description: Evaluates if the submission is very concise and to the point

metrices.name: Controversiality
metrices.description: Checks if the response holds a Neutral tone, avoiding opinions likely to spark heated debate.

metrices.name: Groundedness

metrices.description: Evaluates the response for any sentiment or emotion expressed in a piece of text

metrices.name: Insensitivity
metrices.description: Does the response hold any sensitive information

metrices.name: Stereotype
metrices.description: It evaluates gender bias and stereotype between male and female, and gender minority bias and stereotype between majority and minority

metrices.name: Maliciousness
metrices.description: Checks if the response is meant to deceive or spread negativity?

metrices.name: Tone Critique
metrices.description: Checks the tone of the response

metrices.name: Chaining of Prompts
metrices.description: Cross evaluation performed on LLM to gather the reasoning behind the response

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Rates the readability of the response summary

metrices.name: Source Authenticity Score
metrices.description: To verify the source of the data, metadata

metrices.name: Profanity
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from spelling mistakes, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Cosine Similarity
metrices.description: Check for Cosine similarity between two sentences

metrices.name: Cove
metrices.description: Check for consistency

metrices.name: F1 Score
metrices.description: Balances precision and recall to measure the overall accuracy of the chatbot's responses.

metrices.name: Bleu
metrices.description: Measures the accuracy of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using n-gram precision.

metrices.name: Meteor Score
metrices.description: Assesses the chatbot's responses based on precision, recall, and alignment with human judgment, considering synonyms and stemming.

metrices.name: Rouge 1
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.description: Evaluates the Output questions generated are hallucinated

metrices.description: Simulate attacks to measure the sensitivity of LLMs

metrices.description: Simulate attacks to measure the sensitivity of LLMs

metrices.name: Red Teaming
metrices.description: Simulate attacks to measure the sensitivity of LLMs

metrices.name: Load Resilience Score
metrices.description: Feed high load scenarois and test systems reliability and performance

metrices.name: Ethical Compliance Rate
metrices.description: Generate adverse prompts to ethical guidelines and observe how LLM performs

metrices.name: Toxicity
metrices.description: Detects any patterns of Insult ,obscenity ,threat & dangerous in the O/P and logs it for further analysis

metrices.name: Log Integrity Index
metrices.description: Parse logs to see if there is any pattern of unethical data

metrices.name: Criminality
metrices.description: Check if the response glorifies illegal activities?

metrices.name: Misogyny
metrices.description: Checks if there are any discriminatory language or offensive remarks targeting women or female characters.

metrices.name: Harm Score
metrices.description: Evaluates if there is any usage of harmful language or misinformation?

metrices.name: QAG Hallucination Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes/No summary-based answer and an Unknown document-based answer. A high score suggests the summary might include content absent from the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Contradiction Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes summary-based answer and a No document-based answer, and vice-versa. A high score suggests the summary might include content that contradicts the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Non-informativeness Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Unknown summary-based answer and an Yes/No document-based answer. A high score indicates that the summary may miss details from the document or be very generic.

metrices.description: Measures the accuracy of the context information retrieved

metrices.description: Measures the completeness of the context retrieved

metrices.description: Evaluates if the response includes only important information and excludes redundancies.

name: integration_test1

metrices.name: Data Uniformity Rate
metrices.description: Ensure data is consistent across different sources without any contradictions

metrices.name: Bias Score
metrices.description: Checks if the training data more biased towards any specific age, gender.

metrices.name: Schema conformance score
metrices.description: Evaluates if the data is available in defined formats as per business rules

metrices.name: Data Completeness ratio
metrices.description: Checks for Comprehensive coverage on data

metrices.name: Data Sensitivity
metrices.description: Detection of PII sensitive information in training dataset

metrices.name: Language Match Score
metrices.description: Grades the language match of the response to the input

metrices.name: QA Relevance
metrices.description: Grades how relevant the response was to the question specified.

metrices.name: QC Relevance
metrices.description: Grades how relevant the response was to the context extracted.

metrices.name: Hallucination Degree coefficient
metrices.description: Detects hallucination on 'n' attempts, based on the degree on variance of responses for the same prompt

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: Detects if the response is well-organized and easy to follow and could benefit from the context

metrices.name: Summarization
metrices.description: Evaluates the response summary, if it has captured all the key points of high importance level from the source text.

metrices.name: Concisenses
metrices.description: Evaluates if the submission is very concise and to the point

metrices.name: Controversiality
metrices.description: Checks if the response holds a Neutral tone, avoiding opinions likely to spark heated debate.

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Detects how correct/factual the response is provided for the question asked

metrices.name: Groundedness
metrices.description: A measure to track if the source material supports each sentence in the statement.

metrices.name: Ground Truth Relevance
metrices.description: Compares the actual response against the dataset and derives a score based on similarity.

metrices.name: Sentiment
metrices.description: Evaluates the response for any sentiment or emotion expressed in a piece of text

metrices.name: Insensitivity
metrices.description: Does the response hold any sensitive information

metrices.name: Stereotype
metrices.description: It evaluates gender bias and stereotype between male and female, and gender minority bias and stereotype between majority and minority

metrices.name: Maliciousness
metrices.description: Checks if the response is meant to deceive or spread negativity?

metrices.name: Tone Critique
metrices.description: Checks the tone of the response

metrices.name: Chaining of Prompts
metrices.description: Cross evaluation performed on LLM to gather the reasoning behind the response

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Rates the readability of the response summary

metrices.name: Source Authenticity Score
metrices.description: To verify the source of the data, metadata

metrices.name: Data Evolution Index
metrices.description: Track changes applied to data and cross check the sample response being generated for the same question over a period of time and alert

metrices.name: Profanity
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from spelling mistakes, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Cosine Similarity
metrices.description: Check for Cosine similarity between two sentences

metrices.name: Cove
metrices.description: Check for consistency

metrices.name: F1 Score
metrices.description: Balances precision and recall to measure the overall accuracy of the chatbot's responses.

metrices.name: Bleu
metrices.description: Measures the accuracy of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using n-gram precision.

metrices.name: Meteor Score
metrices.description: Assesses the chatbot's responses based on precision, recall, and alignment with human judgment, considering synonyms and stemming.

metrices.name: Rouge 1
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.name: Rouge 2
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.name: Rouge L
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.name: Hallucination
metrices.description: Evaluates the Output questions generated are hallucinated

metrices.name: Is Unethical
metrices.description: Filters and highlights contents that are Unethical

metrices.name: PII detection
metrices.description: Would detect any PII data being exposed in O/P generated

metrices.name: Jailbreak
metrices.description: Simulate attacks to measure the sensitivity of LLMs

metrices.name: Adversarial Attack
metrices.description: Simulate attacks to measure the sensitivity of LLMs

metrices.name: Red Teaming
metrices.description: Simulate attacks to measure the sensitivity of LLMs

metrices.name: Load Resilience Score
metrices.description: Feed high load scenarois and test systems reliability and performance

metrices.name: Ethical Compliance Rate
metrices.description: Generate adverse prompts to ethical guidelines and observe how LLM performs

metrices.name: Toxicity
metrices.description: Detects any patterns of Insult ,obscenity ,threat & dangerous in the O/P and logs it for further analysis

metrices.name: Log Integrity Index
metrices.description: Parse logs to see if there is any pattern of unethical data

metrices.name: Criminality
metrices.description: Check if the response glorifies illegal activities?

metrices.name: Misogyny
metrices.description: Checks if there are any discriminatory language or offensive remarks targeting women or female characters.

metrices.name: Harm Score
metrices.description: Evaluates if there is any usage of harmful language or misinformation?

metrices.name: QAG Hallucination Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes/No summary-based answer and an Unknown document-based answer. A high score suggests the summary might include content absent from the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Contradiction Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes summary-based answer and a No document-based answer, and vice-versa. A high score suggests the summary might include content that contradicts the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Non-informativeness Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Unknown summary-based answer and an Yes/No document-based answer. A high score indicates that the summary may miss details from the document or be very generic.

metrices.name: Contextual Recall
metrices.description: Measures the accuracy of the context information retrieved

metrices.name: Contextual Precision
metrices.description: Measures the completeness of the context retrieved

metrices.name: Answer Relevancy
metrices.description: Evaluates if the response includes only important information and excludes redundancies.

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Rates the readability of the summary

metrices.name: Faithfulness
metrices.description: A measure to track if the source material supports each sentence in the statement

metrices.name: Instruction Handling Check
metrices.description: Cross checking the response against the instructions provided as part of prompt.

metrices.name: Entity Check
metrices.description: Provides a score based on the overlap of entities between the response and the context.

metrices.name: Gherkin Checks
metrices.description: Framework based Gherkin standards check

metrices.name: Coverage Adherence
metrices.description: Usecase to feature file adherence check

metrices.name: Guideline Adherence
metrices.description: Gherkin standards rule adherence checks

metrices.name: Readability
metrices.description: Assessing the natural flow and readability of text generated by the LLM

metrices.name: Grammar
metrices.description: Grades the quality of the response based on grammar checks

metrices.name: Spell
metrices.description: Grades the quality of the response based on spell checks

metrices.name: Groundedness
metrices.description: A measure to track if the source material supports each sentence in the statement.

metrices.name: Instruction Handling Check
metrices.description: Cross checking the response against the instructions provided as part of prompt

metrices.name: Direct Indirect Speech Check
metrices.description: Evaluates if the output generated is directly addressed or indirectly addressed.
prompts: The following question has been given to an interviewer to ask a candidate. It is required that the question they ask should be in direct speech. Classify it as direct or indirect speech. Question: {input}. Follow the guidelines while generating the output: - Generate the results only for the given question. - Don't create any extra dictionaries. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. 'speech': {Output}, 'reason': <Why you are identifying it as direct/indirect question>

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Rate the coherence of the following QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least coherent and 1 is the most coherent. QUESTION: {Input} When evaluating coherence, consider the following criteria: 1. The QUESTION should be well structured and organized. 2. The QUESTION should convey the information in a clear and logical order. Provide the Final output only in proper JSON FORMAT only as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: The score 01 based on the given criteria reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria. If the score is less, then provide a reason as why it got a less score. SCORE: {Output}

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Evaluates the naturalness, coherence, and grammatical accuracy of the responses to ensure they resemble human conversation.
prompts: You are a Fluency grader; providing the fluency score of the given QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least fluent and 1 is the most fluent. Use the following criteria to pick an appropriate score: 0-0.2: Poor fluency. The QUESTION has many errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it difficult to understand or sounding unnatural. 0.3-0.4: Fair fluency. The QUESTION has some errors that affect the clarity or smoothness of the writing, but the main points are still comprehensible. 0.5-0.7: Good fluency. The QUESTION has few errors and is generally easy to read and follow, but may have some minor issues. 0.8-1.0: Excellent fluency. The QUESTION is well written, with no noticeable errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it easy to read and understand. QUESTION: {input} Provide the final output only in proper JSON FORMAT as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: {output} reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria.

metrices.name: Duplicate
metrices.description: Evaluates if the Output generated has duplicate or similar sounding questions.
prompts: From the given set of questions {Input}, identify if there are any duplicate questions. Determine if they are duplicates based on the following rules: 1. Two questions can be fully or partially duplicate. 2. Fully means they are nearly rephrased versions of each other. 3. Partially means part of the question is the same and the answer to one question would partially answer the other. 4. Multiple questions can be duplicates of each other; list each pair separately. 5. Return the responses as JSON containing all duplicates, specifying whether they are full or partial duplicates, a reason, and a score between 0-10 showing how similar they are based on the criteria given below. Score criteria: Give a score 1-3 if questions are partial duplicates but very slightly similar. Give a score of 4-6 if questions are partial duplicates but are asking similar questions about the same topic or highly related topics. Give a score of 8-9 if questions are partial or fully asking very similar questions about the exact same topics. Give a score of 10 if the questions are fully duplicate. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. questions: {Input}, similarity_score: {Output}

metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Unknown summary-based answer and an Yes/No document-based answer. A high score indicates that the summary may miss details from the document or be very generic.

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: Determines if the elements in the image work together harmoniously to create a unified scene, ensuring visual flow.

metrices.name: Narrative Coherence
metrices.description: Assesses whether the visual elements tell a cohesive story or convey a clear theme, evaluating consistency across objects, expressions, and poses.

metrices.name: Lighting and Shadow
metrices.description: Analyzes the natural balance of lighting and shadows, evaluating their effect on the images depth and realism.

metrices.name: Color Accuracy
metrices.description: Evaluates the natural, realistic appearance of colors across objects, people, and the background, checking for unnatural hues or tones.

metrices.name: Diversity Assessment
metrices.description: Evaluates the representation of age, gender, race, and cultural backgrounds in the image, considering all visual cues and contextual factors.

metrices.name: Relevance Assessment
metrices.description: Assesses the relevance of an image to a given prompt, ensuring alignment with specified objects, colors, shapes, sizes, and alignment as described in the prompt.

metrices.name: Interpretability
metrices.description: Evaluates how clear and easy to understand the image is, based on the elements and themes specified in the prompt, including their prominence and organization.

metrices.description: Assesses the emotional tone of an image based on facial expressions, body language, and contextual cues.

metrices.description: Analyzes the sentiment conveyed in the image, including the emotions expressed by people or animals, as well as the background and other elements.

metrices.name: Bias Score
metrices.description: Checks if the image is biased towards any specific age, gender.

metrices.name: Aesthetic Quality
metrices.description: Evaluates the visual appeal of the image based on composition, color balance, lighting, and harmony of elements.

metrices.name: Detailing
metrices.description: Assesses the level of detail in key elements, such as textures, objects, and people's features or expressions.

metrices.name: Clarity
metrices.description: Assesses whether key elements in the image, such as objects, faces, and background details, are sharp, well-defined, and free from distortions or blurriness.

metrices.name: Scalability
metrices.description: Assesses whether the image maintains its quality and detail when scaled up or down, ensuring clarity and sharpness at various sizes.

metrices.name: Criminality
metrices.description: Check if the image glorifies illegal activities

metrices.name: Misogyny
metrices.description: Checks if there are any discriminatory language or offensive remarks targeting women or female characters.

metrices.description: Checks if the image has any stereotypes

metrices.description: Checks if the image has stayed true to what is specified in the prompt

metrices.name: Object Match

metrices.name: Instruction Compliance
metrices.description: Evaluates how well the image adheres to the instructions outlined in the prompt, checking for required elements, actions, and prohibitions specified by the user.

metrices.name: QAG Non-informativeness Score

Question: {input}. Follow the guidelines while generating the output: - Generate the results only for the given question. - Don't create any extra dictionaries. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. 'speech': {Output}, 'reason': <Why you are identifying it as direct/indirect question>

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Rate the coherence of the following QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least coherent and 1 is the most coherent. QUESTION: {Input} When evaluating coherence, consider the following criteria: 1. The QUESTION should be well structured and organized. 2. The QUESTION should convey the information in a clear and logical order. Provide the Final output only in proper JSON FORMAT only as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: The score 01 based on the given criteria reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria. If the score is less, then provide a reason as why it got a less score. SCORE: {Output}

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Evaluates the naturalness, coherence, and grammatical accuracy of the responses to ensure they resemble human conversation.
prompts: You are a Fluency grader; providing the fluency score of the given QUESTION. Respond only as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is the least fluent and 1 is the most fluent. Use the following criteria to pick an appropriate score: 0-0.2: Poor fluency. The QUESTION has many errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it difficult to understand or sounding unnatural. 0.3-0.4: Fair fluency. The QUESTION has some errors that affect the clarity or smoothness of the writing, but the main points are still comprehensible. 0.5-0.7: Good fluency. The QUESTION has few errors and is generally easy to read and follow, but may have some minor issues. 0.8-1.0: Excellent fluency. The QUESTION is well written, with no noticeable errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, and sentence structure, making it easy to read and understand. QUESTION: {input} Provide the final output only in proper JSON FORMAT as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. score: {output} reason: Provide your reasons for scoring based on the listed criteria.

metrices.name: Duplicate
metrices.description: Evaluates if the Output generated has duplicate or similar sounding questions.
prompts: From the given set of questions {Input}, identify if there are any duplicate questions. Determine if they are duplicates based on the following rules: 1. Two questions can be fully or partially duplicate. 2. Fully means they are nearly rephrased versions of each other. 3. Partially means part of the question is the same and the answer to one question would partially answer the other. 4. Multiple questions can be duplicates of each other; list each pair separately. 5. Return the responses as JSON containing all duplicates, specifying whether they are full or partial duplicates, a reason, and a score between 0-10 showing how similar they are based on the criteria given below. Score criteria: Give a score 1-3 if questions are partial duplicates but very slightly similar. Give a score of 4-6 if questions are partial duplicates but are asking similar questions about the same topic or highly related topics. Give a score of 8-9 if questions are partial or fully asking very similar questions about the exact same topics. Give a score of 10 if the questions are fully duplicate. Provide the final output only in proper JSON format as mentioned below and don't give anything extra supporting string as output. questions: {Input}, similarity_score: {Output}

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: There are various competencies that can be tracked from JD like Tools Frameworks, Software, Knowledge Qualification,Responsibilities,Experience Required, Certifications Education Needed, Soft Skills etc. This metric calculates the coverage of these aspects and provides a score along with the missed competencies

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Evaluates if there are facts present in the context for the response generated

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the questions to highlight if the questions weightage are more aligned to specific skillset

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Context & Question)
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates the relevance between the Context referred from JD and the response being generated

metrices.name: Relevance Check (Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies

metrices.name: Relevance Check (JD Competency & Question)
metrices.description: There are 3 questions being generated for each competency and this metrics evaluates if the response being generated is aligned with its respective competencies provided in the JD

metrices.name: Skill weightage check
metrices.description: This metrics evaluates if the questions generated are more biased towards specific Competency / Skill

metrices.name: Skill contradiction check
metrices.description: Checks if the skillsets generated in the question are in alignment to the skills mentioned in JD. For e.g. JD is on Python developer and in questions generated it will check if all skills mentioned are aligned to python and no contradictory skills are present

metrices.name: Pattern Repeat Check
metrices.description: Evaluates the patterns of question generated for e.g ,8 question start with Tell us why

metrices.name: Grammar Score
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from grammatical errors, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Spelling Score
metrices.description: Ensures the chatbot's responses are free from spelling mistakes.

metrices.name: Sentiment Scorer
metrices.description: To calculate the coherence between answer and context.
prompts: Analyze the provided text and summarize its sentiment. Use clear, concise language to describe the overall emotional tone. Text: {output}
Based on the summary '{output_0}', explain the specific elements of the text that contribute to this sentiment. Provide examples from the text to support your explanation.

Given the detailed explanation '{output_1}', assign a sentiment score from 1 to 10, where 1 represents very negative sentiment and 10 represents very positive sentiment.Please provide the score in json format with the key name as final_score strictly with a numeric value only and dont change the format.

metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text and the ground truth match.

metrices.name: BERT Similarity
metrices.description: Analyses the similarity between summarized text and the ground truth summary.

metrices.name: ROUGE Score
metrices.description: Analyses the overlap between the summarized text and the ground truth summary.

metrices.name: METEOR Score
metrices.description: Assesses the quality of the summarized text.

metrices.name: QA Score
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text contains all the key aspects.

metrices.name: Contradiction Check
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contradict the actual conversation.

metrices.name: Non-Informativeness
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain information not present in the actual conversation.

metrices.name: Factual Accuracy
metrices.description: Ensures the summarization has no factual errors.

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text is fluent.

metrices.name: Completeness
metrices.description: Ensures the summarization covers the key details.

metrices.name: Criminality
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain any criminal activities.

metrices.name: Insensitivity
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain any insensitive words.

metrices.name: Stereotype

metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain profanity.

metrices.description: This metric calculates the coverage of various competencies and tracks missed competencies in the summary.

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the conversation to highlight if the conversation weightage is more aligned to specific skillset

metrices.name: Grammatical Check
metrices.description: Grammatical_Check
prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing customer-submitted text. The input text can take various forms, such as call conversations, documents, customer reviews with grammatical errors, or paragraphs. Your task is to analyze the text based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following text thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Analyze the grammatical errors in the text' Text: {input}.Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment.\n\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

metrices.name: Personally Identifiable Information
metrices.description: Personally Identifiable Information
prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing customer-submitted text. The input text can take various forms, such as call conversations, documents, customer reviews, or paragraphs. Your task is to analyze the text based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following text thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Identify and analyze the presence of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in the text.' Text: {input}.Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment. \n\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: Coverage
prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing customer-submitted text. The input text can take various forms, such as call conversations, documents, customer reviews, or paragraphs. Your task is to analyze the text based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following text thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Evaluate the coverage of the text in terms of completeness, relevance, and comprehensiveness.' Text: {input}. Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment. \n\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing customer-submitted text. The input text can take various forms, such as call conversations, documents, customer reviews, or paragraphs. Criteria: 'Identify the overall sentiment of the text (positive, neutral, or negative) and provide reasoning' Text: {input}. prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing customer-submitted text. The input text can take various forms, such as call conversations, documents, customer reviews, or paragraphs. Your task is to analyze the text based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following text thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Summarize the essential facts or details, such as names, dates, locations, or critical data points' Text: {input}. Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment.\n\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

metrices.name: Direct_Indirect_Speech_Check
metrices.description: Direct Indirect Speech Check
prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing question & answer context. The input text it will be question and answer format.Your task is to analyze the question and answer based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following question and answer thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Classify it as direct or indirect speech and provide reasoning' question: {input}. answer: {output}. Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment.\\\\n\\\\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

Criteria: 'Identify the overall sentiment of the text (positive, neutral, or negative) and provide reasoning' Text: {input}. Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment.\n\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

metrices.name: Key Information Extraction
metrices.description: Key Information Extraction
prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing customer-submitted text. The input text can take various forms, such as call conversations, documents, customer reviews, or paragraphs. Your task is to analyze the text based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following text thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Summarize the essential facts or details, such as names, dates, locations, or critical data points' Text: {input}. Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment.\n\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

metrices.name: Direct_Indirect_Speech_Check
metrices.description: Direct Indirect Speech Check
prompts: You are an AI language model specialized in analyzing question & answer context. The input text it will be question and answer format.Your task is to analyze the question and answer based on the provided criteria. Analyze the following question and answer thoroughly for both explicit and implied content, considering its context, tone, and coherence. Criteria: 'Classify it as direct or indirect speech and provide reasoning' question: {input}. answer: {output}. Be as specific as possible and provide reasoning behind your judgment.\\\\n\\\\n Return a clear output with 'Score:' followed by the numeric score, score must be 0 to 1 and 'Reasoning:' followed by only the reasoning.Don't give anything extra supporting string/special char's as output

desc: This configuration will hold selected metrics

name: Data Assurance checks

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: Ensures the summarization has proper logical structure.

metrices.name: Error Detection
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain any errors.

metrices.name: Exact Match Check
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text and the ground truth match.

metrices.name: BERT Similarity
metrices.description: Analyses the similarity between summarized text and the ground truth summary.

metrices.name: ROUGE Score
metrices.description: Analyses the overlap between the summarized text and the ground truth summary.

metrices.name: METEOR Score
metrices.description: Assesses the quality of the summarized text.

metrices.name: QA Score
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text contains all the key aspects.

metrices.name: Contradiction Check
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contradict the actual conversation.

metrices.name: Non-Informativeness
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain information not present in the actual conversation.

metrices.name: Factual Accuracy
metrices.description: Ensures the summarization has no factual errors.

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text is fluent.

metrices.name: Completeness
metrices.description: Ensures the summarization covers the key details.

metrices.name: Criminality
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain any criminal activities.

metrices.name: Insensitivity
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain any insensitive words.

metrices.name: Stereotype
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain any stereotypical content.

metrices.name: Profanity
metrices.description: Ensures the summarized text does not contain profanity.

metrices.name: PII Detection
metrices.description: Detects the PII elements in the summary.

metrices.name: Unethical
metrices.description: Detects unethical behavior in the summary.

metrices.name: Coverage
metrices.description: This metric calculates the coverage of various competencies and tracks missed competencies in the summary.

metrices.name: Bias
metrices.description: Evaluates the conversation to highlight if the conversation weightage is more aligned to specific skillset

desc: This configuration will hold selected metrics

name: langfuse

metrices.name: Data Uniformity Rate
metrices.description: Ensure data is consistent across different sources without any contradictions

metrices.name: Bias Score
metrices.description: Checks if the training data more biased towards any specific age, gender.

metrices.name: Schema conformance score
metrices.description: Evaluates if the data is available in defined formats as per business rules

metrices.name: Data Completeness ratio
metrices.description: Checks for Comprehensive coverage on data

metrices.name: Data Sensitivity
metrices.description: Detection of PII sensitive information in training dataset

metrices.name: Language Match Score
metrices.description: Grades the language match of the response to the input

metrices.name: QA Relevance
metrices.description: Grades how relevant the response was to the question specified.

metrices.name: QC Relevance
metrices.description: Grades how relevant the response was to the context extracted.

metrices.name: Hallucination Degree coefficient
metrices.description: Detects hallucination on 'n' attempts, based on the degree on variance of responses for the same prompt

metrices.name: Coherence
metrices.description: Detects if the response is well-organized and easy to follow and could benefit from the context

metrices.name: Summarization
metrices.description: Evaluates the response summary, if it has captured all the key points of high importance level from the source text.

metrices.name: Concisenses
metrices.description: Evaluates if the submission is very concise and to the point

metrices.name: Controversiality
metrices.description: Checks if the response holds a Neutral tone, avoiding opinions likely to spark heated debate.

metrices.name: Factuality
metrices.description: Detects how correct/factual the response is provided for the question asked

metrices.name: Groundedness
metrices.description: A measure to track if the source material supports each sentence in the statement.

metrices.name: Ground Truth Relevance
metrices.description: Compares the actual response against the dataset and derives a score based on similarity.

metrices.name: Sentiment
metrices.description: Evaluates the response for any sentiment or emotion expressed in a piece of text

metrices.name: Insensitivity
metrices.description: Does the response hold any sensitive information

metrices.name: Stereotype
metrices.description: It evaluates gender bias and stereotype between male and female, and gender minority bias and stereotype between majority and minority

metrices.name: Maliciousness
metrices.description: Checks if the response is meant to deceive or spread negativity?

metrices.name: Tone Critique
metrices.description: Checks the tone of the response

metrices.name: Chaining of Prompts
metrices.description: Cross evaluation performed on LLM to gather the reasoning behind the response

metrices.name: Fluency
metrices.description: Rates the readability of the response summary

metrices.name: Source Authenticity Score
metrices.description: To verify the source of the data, metadata

metrices.name: Data Evolution Index
metrices.description: Track changes applied to data and cross check the sample response being generated for the same question over a period of time and alert

metrices.name: Profanity
metrices.description: Ensures the responses are free from spelling mistakes, maintaining professional and clear communication.

metrices.name: Cosine Similarity
metrices.description: Check for Cosine similarity between two sentences

metrices.name: Cove
metrices.description: Check for consistency

metrices.name: F1 Score
metrices.description: Balances precision and recall to measure the overall accuracy of the chatbot's responses.

metrices.name: Bleu
metrices.description: Measures the accuracy of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using n-gram precision.

metrices.name: Meteor Score
metrices.description: Assesses the chatbot's responses based on precision, recall, and alignment with human judgment, considering synonyms and stemming.

metrices.name: Rouge 1
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.name: Rouge 2
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.name: Rouge L
metrices.description: Evaluates the quality of the chatbot's responses by comparing them to reference responses using recall-based measures.

metrices.name: QAG Hallucination Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes/No summary-based answer and an Unknown document-based answer. A high score suggests the summary might include content absent from the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Contradiction Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Yes summary-based answer and a No document-based answer, and vice-versa. A high score suggests the summary might include content that contradicts the original document.

metrices.name: QAG Non-informativeness Score
metrices.description: This metric captures the percentage of questions that received a Unknown summary-based answer and an Yes/No document-based answer. A high score indicates that the summary may miss details from the document or be very generic.

metrices.name: Contextual Recall
metrices.description: Measures the accuracy of the context information retrieved

metrices.name: Contextual Precision
metrices.description: Measures the completeness of the context retrieved

metrices.name: Answer Relevancy
metrices.description: Evaluates if the response includes only important information and excludes redundancies.

metrices.name: Faithfulness
metrices.description: A measure to track if the source material supports each sentence in the statement

metrices.name: Instruction Handling Check
